channel.title: External drive[Question]
channel.description:
[b]The drive and the software used for hosting the files:[/b]
External drive - Seagate external ( 320gb ) WAMP Windows vista
[b]The question:[/b]
I bought the external drive for the sole purpose of hosting files, the current way I'm doing so is by making an index file in the certain part of a site just for the purpose of using the include function to pull the web pages from certain parts of my external. How would I make it so that I don't have to use includes, and so that people may be able to browse my files on the external drive freely.
Thanks in advance <3 Cowie`
Edit: After a while longer I've found out about a program called Ceedo. I was wondering if this would work with a FRESH install of WAMP on my ceedo folder of the drive ?

item.title: External drive[Question]
item.dc:creator: @eVokki1 Cowie`
item.description:
@eVokki1 wrote:

[quote=“sppt, post:2, topic:172291”]try something along these lines:
[php]

<?php $dir = "D:\\some\\dir";//do not forget to use \\ rather than \ if(is_dir($dir)) { if($dh = open_dir($dir)) { while(($file = read_dir()) !== FALSE) { echo $file; } close_dir($dh); } } ?>

[/php][/quote]

Thanks for that sppt, but I opped for using the Ceedo program. Installed it, then did a new install of XAMPP instead of WAMP, then put all the programs that needed running for the web server into my startup folder.
